title: How to Renew Your Faith in Christianity

steps.headline: Don't be mad at yourself.
steps.description: It is very easy to lose contact with religion and faith. Realize that you can find your way back, and be better than ever. God loves you and forgives you, and just wants you to love Him and respect His Kingdom.

steps.headline: Know that you are not necessarily an atheist.
steps.description: Just because you have drifted apart from the church, or are having trouble believing doesn't mean you don't believe in God. It just means that you are going through a rough patch, so to speak.

steps.headline: Talk to a priest or minister about coming back to your faith.
steps.description: They will  pray with you and discuss how to return to your faith.

steps.headline: Go to confession, if your faith offers this option.
steps.description: You can discuss all the things you've done wrong, all of the sins you have committed, and feel refreshed.

steps.headline: Join a support group.
steps.description: You are not alone. Many others are having trouble understanding faith, and are on the road back to Jesus. They can help.

steps.headline: Go to church.
steps.description: Once you feel comfortable, and understand the religion, join in.

steps.headline: Attend Bible studies and church related functions.
steps.description: The Bible recommends believers fellowship together.

steps.headline: Read the Bible.
steps.description: Specifically, focus on the promises of God. He has promised to always be with us. He always keeps his promises and even says in the bible we can test his promises. James MacDonald, in his book Always True, tells you where to find these promises in Scripture.

steps.headline: Pray without ceasing.
steps.description: Prayer is not just talking to God, but also listening to Him. Be honest about your doubts and struggles. MacDonald writes,  “when you’re going through hardship, or when you’re heavyhearted and burdened, God rolls up His sleeves and moves toward you in a way that’s unlike any other time.”

steps.headline: Receive the Sacraments.
steps.description: They are Christ's Gifts to us all.

steps.headline: Take Christ's Blessed Mother for your own Blessed Mother too.
steps.description: To love Mary is to adore Christ Jesus.
